about.title: I'm passionate about understanding users needs.

biography.one: My journey to design wasn't linear, from Engineering to UI/UX Design, I've always pursued my creative instincts.
biography.two: My experience spans startups and agencies, where I craft user-centric solutions for mobile apps, SaaS products, websites, and branding.
biography.three: I'm currently working with dewwwe as a Product & Web Designer based in Lyon.
biography.four: I love side projects and discussing over new ideas. And sketching some illustrations too time to time!

contact.help: How can I be of help?

subsections.pangram: The quick brown fox jumped over the lazy dog.

problemDescriptions: With busy lifestyles and jam-packed schedules, it's easy to overlook the needs of our furry and leafy friends. Against the daily grind, even crucial tasks like vet appointments, pet food refills, and plant watering can fall by the wayside. This unintentional neglect can have serious consequences for our beloved companions - or as we call them floofs.

Here is our take, your one-stop solution for managing pet and plant care. This PWA mobile app seamlessly integrates into your daily routine, keeping track of important information, setting reminders, and sharing it all with our friends & family to ensure the well-being of your furry and leafy friends.
So, the Floof app was born!
projectCaseStudy.researchDescription: We've done our homework, extensively analyzing existing pet and plant care apps to understand their strengths and limitations. We've also gathered feedback from pet owners and plant enthusiasts to identify their pain points.
projectCaseStudy.brandDescription: We wanted the Floof App to have a personality that was both playful and sophisticated. We chose a color palette that was both vibrant and calming, and we designed a logo that was both cute and stylish.
projectCaseStudy.userJourneyDescription: We created detailed user journeys to make sure that every step of using the Floof App was intuitive and enjoyable. We wanted to make sure that the app was easy to use for people of all ages and skill levels.
outComeDescriptions: The Floof App is currently in development, but we're already making great progress. We're focusing on the mobile platform because we know that's where our users are spending most of their time.
We're constantly brainstorming new features for the Floof App.
The Floof App is not just a tool for managing pet and plant care; it's a companion for life. It's the perfect way to make sure that your furry and leafy friends are always happy and healthy.

problemDescriptions: As crochet lovers, we are always in research of new and exciting patterns. But sometimes, we come upon some terms or acronyms that we do not recognise quickly.
We want to have sneak peaks to all stitches while we are building our patterns.
So the Knotbook app is born!
projectCaseStudy.researchDescription: Swarmed the internet, tested and played around many applications.
projectCaseStudy.brandDescription: We wanted to create an environment that users will not have a lot of distractions while keeping the cozy side.
projectCaseStudy.userJourneyDescription: We created detailed user journeys to guide us throughout design and development. Due to the complicated flows in the application, created detailed diagrams for the development.
outComeDescriptions: Focused only on the mobile as our users would only need a on-the-go solution. Started with simplest wireframes. Created designs from the basic - minimally styled MVPs to more studied designs.
